senses.ex: He set up the meeting for next week.

Tips.title: Arrange in Advance
Tips.description: Used to talk about planning events before they happen, to avoid confusion.
Tips.example: Let's set up the agenda before the conference.

Tips.title: Active Role
Tips.description: Implies someone is actively organizing, not just participating.
Tips.example: She set up the charity event by herself.

senses.de: To make a piece of equipment ready for use.
senses.ex: He set up the computer in the office.

Tips.title: Technical Readiness
Tips.description: Refers to technical tasks like assembling, installing, or configuring.
Tips.example: I need to set up my printer before I can use it.

Tips.title: Start from Scratch
Tips.description: Means starting with basic components and building to full function.
Tips.example: After moving, I had to set up my home network from scratch.

senses.de: To establish a business or organization.
senses.ex: She set up her own company at the age of 25.

Tips.title: Create New
Tips.description: Used to describe the beginning stages of a business or project.
Tips.example: They decided to set up a new fund for the school.

Tips.title: Entrepreneurial Spirit
Tips.description: Conveys initiative and the start of something entrepreneurial.
Tips.example: He set up a pop-up shop to test his business idea.

senses.de: To falsely make someone seem guilty for something.
senses.ex: He was set up and wrongly accused of stealing.

Tips.title: Innocence Compromised
Tips.description: Suggests someone is made to look guilty unfairly.
Tips.example: I didn't do it; I was set up!

Tips.title: Plot Twists
Tips.description: Often used in storytelling to describe deceitful schemes.
Tips.example: In the movie, the hero was set up to take the fall.
